required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention and Early Detection and Intervention of Post-Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting Surgery (CABG) Acute Kidney Injury (AKI)
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention and Early Detection and Intervention of Post-Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting Surgery (CABG) Acute Kidney Injury (AKI)

brief_summary.textblock: Nephrology participation in care of patients undergoing CABG could reduce AKI through correction of modifiable risk factors and early detection and intervention of post-op AKI.

primary_outcome.measure: Perfusion pressures (mean arterial pressure) â‰¥ 65-70 mmHg

arm_group.description: If participants are randomized into the non-intervention group, the participants' information during the study period will be collected. Participants will be managed by a care provider as per the standard of care. Participants may receive nephrology consultation as indicated clinically.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard of Care plus Nephrology Care
arm_group.description: If participants are randomized into the intervention group, participants' information will be checked by the study investigators daily for 7 days (2 days pre-op and 5 days post-op). When appropriate, investigators may give suggestions to minimize the participants' risk(s) for AKI. Participant's primary care providers may take the suggestions into consideration. Participants' primary care providers are not obligated to carry out the suggestions that are given.

intervention.intervention_name: Standard of Care plus Nephrology Care
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard of Care plus Nephrology Care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (Age >18 years)
- Elective CABG at Mayo Clinic Rochester and Shanghai Zhongshan Hospital from 7/1/2016 to 6/30/2017
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-elective CABG
- Renal failure on dialysis
- Renal transplantation
